attributes.action: Immediately stop and cancel IHAT investigations into British troops
attributes.background: There are investigations into British troops conduct in the Gulf area.  These were initiated by Gordon Brown.  Some investigations are still ongoing and pending, it is totally unfair to do this, our troops are the best in the World and should not be investigated in this way.

attributes.action: Allow full legal costs to be taken into account by the Child Support Agency
attributes.background: When one partner decides to breakup a relationship and leave, taking the children and denying the other partner an acceptable level of access and/or communication, the only recourse the other partner has to achieve reasonable access to their children is to take very costly legal action.
attributes.additional_details: Also, if despite paying a reasonable level of maintenance based on previous household bills, the leaving partner uses the CSA to obtain the maximum possible then paying the resultant determination can drain any available funds to pay for legal costs. This creates a very uneven playing field and therefore, full legal costs should be taken into consideration by the CSA in order that a parent can legally fight for their rights.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for food outlets to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background:
In the uk it is not a legal requirement for food outlets to display their food hygiene ratings. 
 

Many people don't know that you can check online, many people assume the government wouldn't allow somewhere to be open if they received 0-1-2 stars. 

But they are aloud to stay open.
attributes.additional_details:
Check out local places in your area. 
http://ratings.food.gov.uk

My local chicken shop received a 0..
Local Costcutter received a 1
Local Cafe received a 1
All are still open.

Major improvements required
System or checks in place to ensure that food sold or served is safe to eat, the food safety officer has confidence that standards will be maintained in future.

Cleanliness and condition of facilities and building to enable good food hygiene.

http://www.youtube.com/user/FoodStandardsAgency

attributes.action: The abuse of a redhead should be made a criminal offence as a form of racism.
attributes.background:
It's racial abuse and harrassment and works the same as being harassed for having a different colour skin or having a different god. 
It is an 'accepted' form of abuse in society which is wrong as this amount of bullying and mental abuse is dangerous for a person's insecurities or mental health.
attributes.additional_details: I am a strong believer in this being a form of racism and I will never believe it is okay for people to be tortured for being different. People get trauma treatment and counselling due to insecurities and mental illness triggered by the abuse and harassment. People can be rejected from work, friendships, relationships and school events for it. It can have a long lasting impact on those affected and even lead people to suicide.

attributes.action: Ban the release of Helium balloons
attributes.background:
Helium is a rare gas, which is becoming scarce, we allow people to release helium filled balloons for memorials/ celebrations / competitions. 
It causes major problems when the balloons deflate for wildlife and in particular aquatic animals. A number of whale deaths are recently attributed to them.
attributes.additional_details:
http://balloonsblow.org/
http://www.nabas.co.uk/about-balloons/
http://www.abc.net.au/science/surfingscientist/heliumballoons.htm
http://www.onegreenplanet.org/animalsandnature/how-balloon-releases-harm-wildlife/
http://www.mcsuk.org/downloads/pollution/dont%20let%20go.pdf

They are becoming part of the plastic soup we dump into out oceans killing wildlife we cannot continue like this, it a simple start please sign.

attributes.action: Review the Council Tax system so that it reflects individual contributions
attributes.background: I believe that the current Council Tax system is outdated and unfair - taxing households rather than individuals - Why should single households pay almost as much as a 5 occupancy household, why should a property worth millions pay same as a council flat?
attributes.additional_details:
Tax should be paid on individual bases and proportional to each person burden to the local authority - Should 2 pensionnaires household pay same council tax as a family of 5? Should a single working professional pay towards services it does not currently use?
Also with property valuation completely changed from 25 years ago - should household taxation still be considered an option? 
On top of that local councils have constantly risen tax/year and discrepancies between boroughs are huge.

attributes.action: We demand that the government guarantees adequate future funding for the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is in dire risk of future collapse, due primarily to the pressure of inadequate funding from the government. We ask this and future governments to guarantee that the NHS will continue to be a free and full health service, and to commit to funding levels set by an independent expert body.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37331350

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-35653455

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/sep/10/hospitals-on-brink-of-collapse-say-health-chiefs

http://metro.co.uk/2016/09/11/nhs-is-at-tipping-point-as-hospitals-struggle-with-severe-lack-of-funds-6121127/

http://www.itv.com/news/2016-09-11/cash-strapped-hospitals-face-unpalatable-choices-over-care-levels-warns-nhs-chief/

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/08/25/glut-of-nhs-closures-ahead-warn-hospital-chiefs/

attributes.action: Reform the use and duration of Pre-Charge Bail
attributes.background: The current use of Pre-Charge Bail is unacceptable. Firstly, restrictions are imposed upon individuals who have not been charged with a crime, and imposed without evidence. Secondly, there is no maximum duration for this imposition, therefore suspects can be held in legal limbo for years.
attributes.additional_details:
What is Pre-Charge Bail?
Pre-charge bail is a legal loophole in which an individual who has been arrested, but not charged, can be placed on bail while police gather evidence. 

Prime Minister (then Home Secretary) Theresa May has said:
"I have been clear that it is simply not acceptable for individuals to spend months and in some cases years on pre-charge bail, with no system of review, only for charges never to be brought against them."

attributes.action: Instruct Southern Rail to reinvest all profits until they can run a full service
attributes.background: Southern Rail have been running a minimal and intermittant service while harvesting almost £100m in profit. Many of us will have had sympathy that they were dealing with a difficult situation with engineering work and civil action, however news that they are making such a profit shows otherwise.

attributes.action: Organise better system at Dartford Toll. Delays of at least 2 hours unacceptable
attributes.background: I have been using this route for over 30 years and never experienced the delays as I am now, since removing the tolls. Something MUST be dine
attributes.additional_details: It does not matter what time of the day I leave my home in East Sussex, I am delayed for at least 1 and half hours - why??

attributes.action: To support a longer cease-fire in Syria to allow for food and medical aid
attributes.background: After the recent effects of the bombing in Aleppo, Syria, I would like to propose that we support a longer cease-fire to allow for key medical supplies to reach those who have been effected by War.
attributes.additional_details: In previous months the cease-fire has been only 48 hours, however this is too short a period of time for supplies to get to those who need it and to recover from the effects of injury, loss of home and even separation from loved ones.

attributes.action: Train more doctors.
attributes.background: To meet future demands for healthcare, whilst managing the hours worked by doctors, we need more doctors.  There are currently lots of talented people who want to train as doctors but can't because there are not enough places at medical schools.
attributes.additional_details: As well as increasing the number of training places available to people aged 18, the number of places available to people in their 20's (both with and without a first degree in another subject) should be significantly increased to improve access to medicine as a career.  Currently to secure a place at medical school you have to demonstate an excellent academic record, a committment to medicine and a track record of helping others, usually by the age of 17.

attributes.action: Reduce the six week school holidays.
attributes.background: We are now in 2016 which is a different era from times gone by.  Parents work not every parent can rely on free childcare or assistance from grandparents.  When a child is away from school for such a long time it is a detriment to any educational development.
attributes.additional_details: Children go back to school forgetting what they have learned in the previous term.  Many children are not physically active and spend the six week holidays inactive.  Childcare is very expensive children expect to do activities which unfortunately very rarely are free.  Family life is stressful due to the time scale and general cost.  Holidays abroad double.  Time with family is important but we need to look at an agenda which helps parents rather than hinders.  If the holidays are going to continue there needs to be a scheme to aid parents.

attributes.action: Allow Armed forces personal to carry side arms for protection against abduction.
attributes.background: Due to the fact there gave been person's attempting abductions against our service personnel it is time to allow them to carry loaded side arms for protection against abduction.
attributes.additional_details: RAF Marham. Aldershot

attributes.action: Additional EU Referendum for ALL Expats.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule to trigger an additional EU Referendum for all expatriate British Citizens, regardless of the length of time they have resided outside the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
If implemented the result of the June 2016 EU Referendum means the United Kingdom would leave the World’s most influential network of nations on the base of a remarkably thin majority for such a huge step.
This is the decision of a lifetime to ALL British Citizens, wherever they live, yet the outcome was based on an undemocratic principle.
The millions of British citizens residing outside the UK are not only grass-roots ambassadors of the UK spread all over the planet but are affected by the result of the EU Referendum just as much as, if not more so, than UK residents.
However, millions of expats resident outside the UK for more than 15 years were not eligible to vote and were in effect disenfranchised. Therefore the result is not democratically legitimate.

attributes.action: To enforce that the CMS deal with both maintenance & contact thorough mediation
attributes.background: For the CMS to enforce that mediation must be attended by both parents in exchange for their  services. Both contact and maintenance are discussed and put to the courts. Solicitors and mediatiors can attend. Saving so much trouble and heart ache.
attributes.additional_details: Over the last two years I have gone through great troubles to arrange contact with my son Lucas. Since going through this I have noticed that there are several people going through the same... Alienation, unfair judgement in court, expensive solicitors. The CMS has sonics  legal power to peruse the money but don't do the same for contact. Making it easier to seperate a non living parent from their child with no obligation to maintain a healthy relationship between them. This must be stopped .

attributes.action: Road works on motorways should require 24/7 working.
attributes.background: Road works on motorways and major public roads should have 24/7 working to reduce loss of trade to local business and increased inconvenience to the UK population. The UK will be globally more effective and prosperous if the UK's transport links are more efficient.
attributes.additional_details: A short term pain, will lead to a long term gain.

attributes.action: Help London workers and locals be home owners: restrict multi-property buying.
attributes.background: London house prices keep soaring, and only wealthy UK and foreign investors benefit as they buy up the capital, at prices only they can afford. Home owning is unattainable for locals and workers living in the capital, making renting their only option. Again, rents are high and saving to buy is hard.
attributes.additional_details:
Laws need to be put into place to restrict mass buying from wealthy individuals, as well control on companies.
London is driven by its workers/locals but house prices are causing people to leave to other cities. Plus those commuting into London are being pushed further out as the outskirts also become unaffordable. 
This petition urges the Government implement laws to help more people become home owners in the Capital, and restrict the benefits to investors raking in ridiculous rental income!

attributes.action: stop the WPD from making radical changes to existing final salary schemes
attributes.background: All existing final salary schemes were signed  by the individual and the company after full explanation of the contents and should be legally binding .They should not be able to be manipulated by Ministers or the Work and Pensions department years later .

attributes.action: All public transport buses to have seat belts.
attributes.background: I have seen many videos on social media of buses in road accidents. Passengers fly out of their seats. Young children fly out of their seats. I for one will not be taking my child on a bus until they have seat belts fitted. A bus is no different to a car. In fact it's probably worse.

attributes.action: Compel Bacs to process payments over a maximum 1-day execution time
attributes.background: In 2007 the EU declared rapid payments essential for a modern and properly functioning economy, adding that there is no reason why payments should not be made by the end of the next business day at the latest. Why, then, nine years later, does Bacs still take three days to process payments?
attributes.additional_details: In 2016, 3-day payments should be redundant. For an electronic payment to take 3 days to process is unacceptable. A cheque which clears on the fourth day is barely any slower. And yet, Bacs is the only option for direct debits, the only RTI-enabled option for payroll payments, and the entrenched option for all other payments. There was no reason in 2007, and there remains no reason today, why all these payments should not be processed over a maximum 1-day execution time, by default.

attributes.action: Introduce PR to resolve the deep divisions created by the EU referendum.
attributes.background: Self-explanatory
attributes.additional_details: The referendum demanded a single answer to a complex question, was unbalanced in terms of outcome (one being final) and was decided by a narrow margin.

attributes.action: Investigate the Use of an Oral TB Vaccine for Badgers.
attributes.background: The US are saving an endangered species of ferret from Sylvatic plague using an oral vaccine deployed in food. Can we adapt these ideas and find an oral TB vaccine for badgers with a food we can deploy near setts for them to eat?
attributes.additional_details:
I Googled oral TB vaccine and found there is one for humans and it's more effective than the jab.Oral TB Vaccine: 

http://www.australasianscience.com.au/article/issue-december-2012/oral-tb-vaccine-better-needle.html

The main objection to vaccination has always been the difficulty in trapping and injection. This solves that problem.

Ferret Vaccination Details: http://www.theverge.com/2016/7/12/12161792/ferret-candy-vaccine-drones-montana

attributes.action: Use £23.4 billion  Trident costs to feed, protect and educate our children.
attributes.background: Every year the poorest people in Britain are asked to support other poor people by donating to children in need etc.  We ask that the money for Trident be spent to protect vulnerable children and that those who want Trident hold a telethon to raise money for it.
attributes.additional_details: People of all ages, but especially children are suffering and living in unacceptable poverty whilst hard working tax payers watch their money being spent on weapons of mass destruction that aren't wanted and will never be used.  This must change.

attributes.action: Tighten regulation on news media to prevent the manipulation of public opinion.
attributes.background: The recent referendum showed that some newspapers were heavily pushing their readership to vote a specific way, readers who only used those newspapers to make their decision may have voted without balanced arguments and hence may have been subject to manipulation of opinion by the newspaper itself.
attributes.additional_details: All news media organisations that publish in the public domain should hold a responsibility to provide a balanced view, rather than only printing facts or opinion that support the organisations own stance. The impartiality rules that govern the BBC’s political stance, should be considered for the rest of the news media organisations. The public needs to be provided with balanced facts and opinions to allow them to make their own decisions, rather than be steered by an organisations own view.

attributes.action: Use motorway matrix signs to say "Keep left unless overtaking."
attributes.background: This could be used where appropriate to remind drivers that are driving in centre lanes to move over. Thus helping traffic flow.

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading laws.
attributes.background: Scotland has abolished them, so why can't we!

attributes.action: Debate the UN report on human rights abuses and austerity
attributes.background:
The UN has produced a report which states the UK’s austerity policies are in breach of international human rights obligations.
The UN are “seriously concerned” by the state of inequality in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
UN report: E/C.12/GBR/CO/6
Download here:
http://tbinternet.ohchr.org/_layouts/treatybodyexternal/SessionDetails1.aspx?SessionID=1059&Lang=en

attributes.action: Hold General Election once a Tory leader's found & before Artcle 50 is triggered
attributes.background: The U.K. Government should represent the people of the U.K.  Following the recent referendum both major parties at Westminster have seemingly imploded. Once new party leaders have been found the UK should decide who is right to govern them.
attributes.additional_details: This should also be done before Article 50 is invoked so that the Prime Minister leading the negotiations has the backing of the people

attributes.action: Parliament should set up an Office for Electoral Information Integrity.
attributes.background: In the modern age it is possible for all well intentioned MP's to sometimes present incorrect information or correct information in a misleading way. This erodes public confidence both in MPs as well as in the whole political system, which ultimately undermines democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
The OEII would have the following functions:
1) define and publish standards for information impartiality and comprehensibility
2) provide advice to MPs on how best to present information in an impartial and generally comprehensible way
3) during the purdah period in the run up to elections or referenda, it would scrutinise information placed in the public domain by political parties or groups and would issue public statements describing how the presented information is deficient when needed.

attributes.action: To implement a Civil Law consequence to racist and xenophobic behaviour.
attributes.background: We need to promote tolerance and equality now more than ever. This proposal is IN ADDITION to The Equality Act 2010. A number of racist and xenophobic offences do not reach a conviction in court due to a lack of evidence. We propose that some incidences could be settled under Civil Law.
attributes.additional_details: Proposal: Party A is victim to racist or xenophobic behaviour by Party B. Party C is witness to the event and gives a statement. A document states Party A will not press charges if Party B agrees to pay a significant fine OR attends a Humanity awareness course which will aim to educate and promote tolerance and understanding. The course completion will be subject to the course provider certifying that party B demonstrated remorse and engaged with the subject matter.

attributes.action: If a fathers name isn't on the birth certificate women shouldn't claim CSA
attributes.background: If women chose not to put the fathers name on the birth certificate they SHOULDN'T have the right to claim CSA unless both parents are on the certificate

attributes.action: Ban tenant renewal fees
attributes.background: Why should we, the tenants, or even the landlords, have to pay out an extreme amount of money just for estate agents to print out the exact same paper as they did before, with just a couple of numbers changed? I SAY NO!
attributes.additional_details:
This world is hard enough you love in with all the prices on rent, bill, shopping etc, increasing all the time.
Estate agents make enough money from us.
It's extortionate for them to request more money for then to do absolutely nothing other than print out a bit of paper.
Anyone can do this.

That money being requested could go towards a lot of things you need.
DON'T let them keep doing this to you.
DON'T let them rip you off!!
Sign now, and let's fight back to take what is OURS!!

attributes.action: Verify the quantum of EU Referendum votes made on the basis of lies & untruths
attributes.background: The 23 June 2016 EU Referendum, has set a path for the UK which is likely to cause significant damage to the economy and send the UK into recession. It has emerged that many voters cast their votes on the basis of lies, untruths and misrepresentation of facts by both the Leave & Remain campaigns.
attributes.additional_details:
Following the Leave and Remain Campaigns backtracking on the various promises and statements that they made to the electorate,  the leading polling consultants have now determined that many voters cast their votes on the basis of these claims that have now been proven to be lies and untruths and many voters have confirmed they would now cast their votes differently.

The Government needs to determine if this sample is statistically relevant and if it could have affected the outcome of the result

attributes.action: CHANGE THE LAW TO PROTECT ANIMALS FROM THREATS OF VIOLENCE AND DEATH FROM PEOPLE
attributes.background: Animal protection laws need to be change so it become illegal for people to threaten to kill someones animals.
attributes.additional_details: As it stands at the moment it is not a criminal offence to tell people that they will kill your animals and they can get away with with completely until they have caused harm to the animal. We need to have this changed so that people will get some kind of criminal conviction for threatening peoples animals.

attributes.action: Stop Imports from Germany
attributes.background: The 3 month forecast shows for the month of April, the UK spent nearly 9 billion pounds on imports from Germany alone, Now that we have voted as a country and have decided to leave the Eu they are playing around with the pound, Nothing has stopped as of yet and trade remains the same. And for why ?
attributes.additional_details:
We need to stop trade with Germany, We need to stay together as a country and stay strong, Lets not let them play us, we can trade else where. 
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/527976/OTS_Release_0416.pdf

We need to focus on world trade and get our £ on a good exchange and to do this we need to stop trade with those who are trying to bring us down.

attributes.action: Ban petitions relating to election results as it insults democracy
attributes.background: There has been a glut of petitions which call for another vote when things don't go their way.  This insults our voters, makes a mockery of the democratic process and wastes time as its debated.  It also undermines other petitions which may have real value and real merit.

attributes.action: Continue a pro immigration policy and recognise the value migrants bring the UK
attributes.background: As part of the EU exit negotiations the UK government should seek a deal that will maintain the current rights of all EU citizens in the UK and that will keep the UK border open to economic migrants and refugees alike.
attributes.additional_details:
In addition the UK government should take steps to fully explain to the public the great benefits that migration brings to the UK.

A large number of people who voted to leave in the recent referendum will have done so as a rejection of the federalist agenda of the EU and in favour of national sovereignty and democracy. They did not vote for a rejection of migrants or as a vote to close our borders. As such there is no mandate for a anti immigration policy

attributes.action: Honour the Brexit result by repealing s2, European Communities Act 1972, NOW.
attributes.background: In view of another petition demanding that the Brexit result be ignored and another referendum held, we clearly need an alternative one that can be supported by all those who believe in democracy.

attributes.action: Reword Rule 59 of the Highway code from 'should' to 'must'
attributes.background: The current wording of Rule 59 allows cyclists to ignore the suggestions. The rule should be revised so that cyclists MUST wear a safety helmet and at least one article of fluorescent or reflective clothing and/or accessory (visible from front and rear) at all times when cycling on the highway.
attributes.additional_details:
Car drivers and passengers MUST wear a safety belt, therefore it stands to reason that cyclists MUST wear a cycling helmet and a fluorescent/reflective item when cycling. This would help to reduce the number of incidents which occur on the roads.
There were 21,287 reported cycling casualties in 2014. Source: http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/pedal-cyclists/facts-figures/
Many of these could have been avoided if cyclists were easier to see.

attributes.action: National insurance should pay for old peoples care, not council tax
attributes.background:
Council tax is a blunt tool, not related to income, and therefore ability to pay.
Many councils are in financial trouble, because of the squeeze from government, and inflationary pressures.
Government can redistribute cash to the areas that need it. leaving the councils to deal with local issues

attributes.action: Diwali is Hindu festival and for lot of Hindu it is also their New year as well.
attributes.background: If Diwali is made as a National Holiday like Christmas then it will save Hindu people to use their holiday

attributes.action: Stop Network Rail removing lineside trees for their own commercial gain.
attributes.background: Recently a residential area within Stirling received generic letters for Network Rail advising that from 26th November 2016 they were going to be removing trees and plants from their lineside. They advised this was to minimise the risk of disrupting railway operations.
attributes.additional_details: This proposed action is completely unjustified and un-proportionate. They have not considered the impact on the environment, wildlife and the effect it will have for local residents. The letter states that they will be removing trees,plants and vegetation unto 10 meters from their lineside, this will in effect create a concrete jungle and damage the beautiful aesthetics of Stirling. This must be opposed and stopped as the impact of this is far greater than the commercial gain of a company.

attributes.action: Bring 'Hands-on' STEM Back to Schools
attributes.background: As a STEM Educator and STEM Charity Owner, a important issue has come to light, that a lot of 'Hands-on' STEM skills have been stripped from young people's STEM education, leading to a large skill short-fall when student's carry on studying STEM subjects at university.
attributes.additional_details: Information about this subject has been collected and analysed by volunteers at GlamSci (www.GlamSci.org) whom are a non-profit STEM educational charity concerned with young people's education and rights to STEM subjects. This view is backed by current educational figures gathered by STEM governing bodies, universities and other educational organisations.

attributes.action: Introduce online cyber-security and forensics degree courses for UK residents.
attributes.background: I am requesting the UK Government to introduce affordable and highly rated cyber-security and forensic degree courses for people with hidden conditions and other people alike all over the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: This would fulfill the dreams for those wishing to pursue security degree courses. Most national cyber threats could be eliminated by simply introducing online degree course in conjunction with some of our reputed universities.

attributes.action: To make November 11th a bank holiday
attributes.background: To remember all the fallen heros

attributes.action: Prevent companies from defaulting the 'save payment information' on a website
attributes.background: Typically when purchasing online goods, companies by default check the 'Save these payment details'. Saving payment details online isn't a good thing and whilst the option should be there, it shouldn't be defaulted. This should be addressed and could potentially save people from fraudulent purchases
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was the victim of fraud as I may have mistakenly saved my payment card details on a website that was later compromised.

attributes.action: Update the infrastructure for Army families in Woolwich
attributes.background: The soldiers & their families in Woolwich living in Service Family Accommodation don't enjoy Fibre Broadband despite surrounding areas being connected. Internet is used to stay in touch with loved ones (deployed) and it's a disgrace that for economic reasons infrastructure is left outdated.
attributes.additional_details: All parties in relation to the issue have been contacted with no result so far in 2 years. BT and Virgin cannot make a business case and the MoD told us residents need to self-fund fibre. Self funding however is not an option for a large portion of soldier families being attached to The Vikings, who re-locate every 5 years! The council has no jurisdiction. We've been left to struggle with inconceivably slow broadband surrounded by private housing with fibre access, in a London suburb in zone 4.

attributes.action: Private companies must allow 10 minutes before issue of a parking invoice.
attributes.background: Many retail parks, housing developments and busimesses use private parking companies to control parking in their carparks or roads. We believe these companies should be legally required to allow the driver to overstay by a maximum of ten minutes, just as traffic wardens and council wardens have to.
attributes.additional_details: If you are held up at the till because there are not enough staff at the checkouts, is it fair to be charged by the parking company that the store employs? Is it right to receive a ticket because you pulled up at your door to unload shopping before taking your car to the official car park? No, it isn't. These charges are exhorbitant and unfair. They should have to allow at least a few minutes grace before pouncing and issuing a fine.

attributes.action: Make it an arrest-able offence for protesters to obstruct roads of any kind
attributes.background: As people are aware protesters come in all different forms and from different beliefs. For those who chose to protest in roads whether it be a side road, entrance to a work sight, or a main road. This is petition is to help make it an arrest-able offence to block roads of any kind.
attributes.additional_details:
Helping stop protesters obstructing roads and access of the road; by making it an arrest-able offence to cause obstruction or disruption too any road of any kind.
This could help prevent companies suing or losing business and increase awareness for road safety and the dangers of protesters using main roads or side roads of any kind.
